title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 14-10.1 - Formula for maximum allowable working pressure
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 14-10.1 - Formula for maximum allowable working pressure

State Regulations

The maximum allowable working pressure on the shell or
drum of a boiler shall be determined by the strength of the weakest course
computed from the thickness of the plate, the tensile strength of the plate, the efficiency of the longitudinal joint, or of the ligament between the tube
holes in shell or drum (whichever is the least), the inside diameter of the
course and the factor of safety allowed by this Subpart. (TS x t x E/R x FS) = maximum allowable working
pressure, pounds per square inch, where
TS =ultimate tensile strength of shell plates, pounds
per square inch, t =thickness of shell plate, in weakest course, inch, E =efficiency of longitudinal joint, or of ligaments
between tube holes (whichever is the least), R =inside radius of the weakest course of the shell or
drum, inches, FS =factor of safety allowed by this

Subpart. Notes
